key_title: Key to the species of Solanum

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Solanaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Solanaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Solanaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

items.item_name: Solanum oligacanthum  (see note under genus profile)
Solanum petrophilum (see note under genus profile)
Solanum tuberosum (see note under genus profile)

leads.lead_text: Berry 5–7 cm long; corolla pink in bud and usually when open; connective large, conspicuous at back of anther
Berry 0.5–4 cm long; corolla white, purple, blue, mauve, or yellow; connective small, inconspicuous at back of anther
Inflorescence branched; flowers usually more than 20
Inflorescence simple or once-forked; flowers usually less than 20
Plant glabrous or with simple or branched hairs
Plant with dense stellate hairs at least on young growth and/or inflorescences
Perennial climber with stems usually more than 1 m long
Perennial tuberous or non-tuberous herbs with stems usually less than 1 m long
Perennial non-tuberous herb; leaves 3–9 cm long, entire or almost so; corolla stellate; berry black
Perennial tuberous herb; leaves 10–20 cm long, deeply lobed; corolla rotate; berry green; garden potato, not truly naturalised, not treated further
Prickles absent; leaves entire; peduncle 3–15 cm long; pedicels  2–3 mm long; corolla 15–25 mm diam., violet
Prickles present; leaves deeply lobed; peduncle 1–2 cm long; pedicels 10–15 mm long; corolla 30–35 mm diam., white
Stellate hairs and/or prickles present
Stellate hairs absent; prickles rare or absent
Perennial climber
Herbaceous annuals or perennials or shrubs, never climbing
Corolla entirely yellow; anthers opening by slits; garden tomato
Corolla never entirely yellow, sometimes white with yellow centre; anthers opening by apical pores
Corolla white or tinged with purple, stellate, 5–20 mm diam.; berry 4–15 mm long
Corolla purple, more or less rotate, 20–50 mm diam.; berry 15–30 mm long
Leaves mostly undulate or lobed
Leaves mostly entire
Leaves linear to narrow-elliptic, usually more than 10 times as long as wide
Leaves lanceolate or elliptic, usually less than 10 times as long as wide
Fruiting pedicels usually less than 30 mm long; berry 15–20 mm diam., yellow with purple markings
Fruiting pedicels usually 30–50 mm long; berry 20–25 mm diam., greenish
Corolla 20–30 mm diam.; berry globose
Corolla 25–50 mm diam.; berry ovoid to ellipsoid
Corolla-lobes acute; berry orange-red to scarlet; stone-cell granules inconspicuous in pressed fruit
Corolla-lobes notched; berry orange-yellow; stone-cell granules conspicuous in pressed fruit
Leaves shallowly lobed at base only
Leaves deeply lobed throughout
Berry orange-yellow, orange-red or scarlet
Berry yellow or green, sometimes purplish in upper half
Corolla-lobes acute; berry orange-red to scarlet; stone-cell granules inconspicuous in pressed fruit
Corolla-lobes notched; berry orange-yellow; stone-cell granules conspicuous in pressed fruit
Fruiting pedicels usually less than 30 mm long; berry 15–20 mm diam., yellow with purple markings
Fruiting pedicels usually 30–50 mm long; berry 20–25 mm diam., greenish
Leaves deeply lobed; plant prostrate or sprawling
Leaves usually entire or shallowly lobed; plant erect or sprawling
Leaves usually less than 20 mm wide; leaf hairs, if present, forked; berry bright orange-red, 10–15 mm diam., 1 or 2 per inflorescence

Leaves usually more than 20 mm wide (at least in first year of growth); leaf hairs not forked; berry not bright orange-red (or if orange-red as in S. villosum, then berry < 10 mm diam.), usually more than 2 per inflorescence
Fruiting peduncle sharply deflexed from its base
Fruiting peduncle erect, ascending or curved downwards, not sharply deflexed from its base
Leaves discolorous, whitish on lower surface; mature berry 5–9 mm diam., blackish; calyx-lobes 2–4 mm long in fruit
Leaves concolorous, green on lower surface; mature berry 8–10 mm diam., green; calyx-lobes 1–2.5 mm long in fruit
Inflorescence forked
Inflorescence simple
Plant sprawling; mature berry green
Plant more or less erect; mature berry black,  purple-black or orange-red
Indumentum mainly of non-glandular hairs; calyx-lobes 1–2.5 mm long, 1–2 mm wide in fruit; berry 8–10 mm diam
Indumentum of glandular hairs; calyx-lobes 2.5–4 mm long, 3–4 mm wide in fruit; berry 6–9 mm diam
Mature berry dull orange-red, translucent
Mature berry dull or shiny, black or purple-black, opaque
Mature berry very shiny; seeds usually more than 40 per fruit
Mature berry rather dull; seeds usually fewer than 40 per fruit
Stigma not more than 1 mm above anther tips; corolla 8–12 mm diam
Stigma 2–3.5 mm above anther tips; corolla 10–20 mm diam
Hairs mostly simple or glandular
Hairs mostly stellate
Prickles absent or rare
Prickles present on stems, leaves, petioles and/or inflorescences
Inflorescence forked
Inflorescence simple
Leaves sparsely pubescent on upper surface
Leaves densely to moderately pubescent on upper surface
Leaves shallowly lobed
Leaves entire or slightly undulate

Perennial shrub 0.5-1 (–3) m high; leaves discolorous; upper leaf surface stellate hairs with 12–16 lateral rays; flowers 5-merous, andromonoecious; skin on mature berry brittle and breaking irregularly

Perennial shrubs 15–30(–40) cm high; leaves concolorous; upper leaf surface stellate hairs with 6–12 lateral rays; flowers 4- or 5-merous, bisexual; skin on mature berry neither brittle nor breaking irregularly
Leaves usually silvery-green; upper leaf surface stellate hairs with 8–9 lateral rays; peduncle to 10 mm long; flowers 4- or 5-merous sometimes on the same plant
Leaves usually grey-green; upper leaf surface stellate hairs with 6–12 lateral rays; peduncle 10–40 mm long
Fruiting calyx or calyx-lobes enclosing or surrounding at least three-quarters of berry
Fruiting calyx or calyx-lobes not enclosing or surrounding at least three-quarters of berry
Berry mostly enclosed by enlarged calyx-tube; corolla bright yellow
Berry mostly enclosed by enlarged calyx-lobes; corolla purple, pale blue or white
Berry red when mature, 15–20 mm diam.; corolla white or pale blue, 35–50 mm diam.
Berry yellow when mature, 8–10 mm diam.; corolla purple, 25–30 mm diam.; noted once in Charlton, not regarded as naturalised, not treated further
Berry 30–40 mm diam.; upper surface of leaf with silvery edges
Berry usually less than 30 mm diam.; upper surface of leaf without silvery edges
Corolla campanulate
Corolla rotate or stellate
Corolla deeply campanulate; leaf indumentum, if present, of similar density on both surfaces
Corolla shallowly campanulate; leaf indumentum sparse on upper surface, denser on lower surface
Berry 15–20 mm diam., dark brown; inflorescence a 3–7-flowered cyme
Berry 25–30 mm diam., yellow; inflorescence a 1–3-flowered cluster
Leaves distinctly lobed, usually at least a quarter way to midvein
Leaves shallowly lobed or entire
Lower surface of leaves sparsely pubescent or glabrescent (ignoring spines)
Lower surface of leaves densely to moderately pubescent
Anthers 5–6 mm long; berry 20–35 mm diam., brown or black
Anthers 2–2.5 mm long; berry 15–20 mm diam., green or purple
Upper surface of leaves densely to moderately pubescent
Upper surface of leaves sparsely pubescent
Berry mucilaginous; fruiting calyx-lobes not firmly appressed to berry
Berry hard and bony; fruiting calyx-lobes firmly appressed to berry; noted once in Charlton, not regarded as naturalised, not treated further
Berry 10–25 mm diam.; leaves usually distinctly discolorous
Berry 20–35 mm diam.; leaves concolorous or slightly discolorous
Prickles bright red or orange-red; calyx-lobes 1–1.5 mm long at anthesis; berry 10–15 mm diam.
Prickles pale yellow or pale orange; calyx-lobes 2.5–5 mm long at anthesis; berry 15–25 mm diam.
Lower surface of leaves densely woolly-pubescent; calyx-lobes triangular at anthesis
Lower surface of leaves not woolly-pubescent; calyx-lobes usually linear at anthesis
Berry yellow; inflorescence a 1–3-flowered cluster
Berry brown or black; inflorescence a 1–6-flowered raceme
Leaves shallowly lobed
Leaves entire or slightly undulate
Leaves distinctly discolorous, upper surface sparsely pubescent
Leaves concolorous or slightly discolorous, upper surface densely pubescent
Berry hard and bony; fruiting calyx-lobes firmly appressed to berry: noted once in Charlton, not regarded as naturalised, not treated further
Berry not hard and bony; fruiting calyx-lobes not firmly appressed to berry
Prickles usually red; leaves silvery-green; flowering peduncle to 10 mm long; anthers 5–12 mm long
Prickles never red; leaves grey-green or pale green; flowering peduncle 10–40 mm long; anthers 4–5 mm long
Upper surface of leaves sparsely pubescent or glabrous
Upper surface of leaves densely pubescent
Berry hard and bony, the lower half enclosed by calyx
Berry succulent, the lower half not enclosed by calyx
Prickles usually present on leaves and petioles
Prickles absent from leaves and petioles
Peduncle 10–40 mm long; berry ovate, obovate or subglobose, the apex acute
Peduncle to 10 mm long; berry depressed-globose, the apex not acute
Leaves oblong to ovate, mostly >2 cm and up to 5 cm long
Leaves rotund to broad-ovate, to 2 cm long
